one.title: FIRST DAY: Read the notes and the references.

questions.questionText: 1. Use this space to record how you have seen God's activity during the week. (How has He provided, answered, comforted, reconciled, guided, etc.?)
2. From the past week's study, what made the most significant impact to you in the notes, lecture, group sharing or personal study?

two.title:
SECOND DAY: Read 2 Samuel 8.
King David defeated Israel's enemies.

questions.questionText: 3. Note the nations David subdued. What did these victories mean for David and the nation of Israel?
4. What repeated sentence reveals the true reason for David's military success? What are some ways people today acknowledge God in their successes?
5. How did David use the articles and plunder he collected from the defeated nations? What would it look like to dedicate resources to God in your culture?
6. Describe David's leadership and character. How would you like those over whom you hold power or influence describe you?

three.title:
THIRD DAY: Read 2 Samuel 9.
David found Mephibosheth and cared for him as a son.

questions.questionText: 7. Why did David want to find someone in Saul's family? What does this tell you about him? (See also 1 Samuel 20:14-15, 42.)
8. What promises did David make to members of Saul's household? When have you given or received something undeserved?
9. How do you treat the marginalized and forgotten in your society? To whom is God reminding you to show kindness?

four.title:
FOURTH DAY: Read 2 Samuel 9; Ephesians 2:1-10.
David reflected Jesus through the grace he extended to Mephibosheth.

questions.questionText: 10. Describe God's love, grace, mercy and salvation from Ephesians 2:1-10.
11. How is David's treatment of Mephibosheth similar to God's grace and mercy in Christ Jesus? (Use any Bible passage, such as John 3:16-18; Romans 3:23-25; 8:15-30; Ephesians 1:3-8.)
12. When and how have you experienced God's mercy? How will you express your gratitude to God?

five.title:
FIFTH DAY: Read 2 Samuel 10; Psalm 60.
David defeated the Ammonites and Arameans.

questions.questionText: 13. What misunderstanding resulted in the Ammonites' conflict with Israel? How have you faced similar circumstances? What were the results?
14. Even though Joab made and executed a battle plan, what was the source of Joab's confidence? What do you learn that you can apply in your present situation?
15. Psalm 60 was written in response to the events of 2 Samuel 8 and 10. How does this psalm encourage or challenge you?
16. What would you like to see God do in your life this week?
